channel.title: How to add ::update command

item.title: How to add ::update command
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Do ::update x amount of time. i.e;

::update 60 would put the update timer on for a minute.

edit:

PlayerHandler.updateStartTime =15; System.currentTimeMillis(); }

why is there a 15 there? there should not be a 15 there.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owneradam")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 5; PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = true; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

It’s no wonder you didn’t get an error.
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#currentTimeMillis()

Read full topic

item.title: How to add ::update command
item.dc:creator: @rscoder4life rscoder4life
item.description:
@rscoder4life wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

Project insanity should already have an update command. And if your name has a space in it, that’s why you typed your name as if it was one big word ‘owneradam’ :P.

my name is owneradam :3 but i fixed it so it just updates right when i type it, how do i put a timer on it?

item.title: How to add ::update command

item.description:
@rscoder4life wrote:

there is already a ::update command but i cant get it to work… heres code:[code]
}
}

}

public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{
    
		if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owneradam")) {
			String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
			int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
			PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 5;
			PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateStartTime =15; System.currentTimeMillis();
		}[/code]
